docs.snippet: Alan Kulwicki regained the lead with 26 laps left and held on to win the Food City 500 Nascar race this afternoon by 78-hundredths of a second over Dale Jarrett.   The big story going into the race was Bill Elliott's bid to win his fifth straight ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Alan Kulwicki regained the lead with 26 laps left and held on to win the Food City 500 Nascar race this afternoon by 78-hundredths of a second over Dale Jarrett. The big story going into the race was Bill Elliott's bid to win his fifth straight race, which would have set a modern-era Nascar record. But Elliott crashed on the 31st lap and again on lap 250 and was never a factor.

docs.snippet: A Labeling Proposal Is Revived     When Federal agencies propose regulations, there usually is a period of time set aside for interested parties and the general public to submit their opinions about the new rules. Last year, in response to demands...
docs.abstract: Customs Service invites comments on proposal to require more conspicuous labeling of frozen foods for country of origin (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: A Labeling Proposal Is Revived When Federal agencies propose regulations, there usually is a period of time set aside for interested parties and the general public to submit their opinions about the new rules. Last year, in response to demands from some growers and food processers, the United States Customs Service proposed that the packaging of frozen food containing imported produce be required to have a label on its front showing the country of origin. Current law requires such a label, but not necessarily on the front. Typically, wording like ''product of Mexico'' appears in small print on the back, or may even be stamped in runny ink on the side of the package, even though the regulation requires that the label be conspicuous. United Foods, which makes Pict Sweet frozen foods and uses no imported produce, lobbied for the new rule. But during the two-month comment period, its submission was the only one to argue for the proposal. The agency received 55 formal objections from food companies, importers and the Frozen Food Institute, a trade group, complaining that labeling was already required and that the new labeling would be expensive and too complicated to apply to items like mixed vegetables, which can come from more than one source. The Customs Service withdrew the proposal in February.

docs.snippet: Haagen-Dazs Margaritas       Haagen-Dazs has introduced a margarita sorbet that tastes just like a frozen margarita. The ingredients include tequila, but the label states that the product has less than 1 percent alcohol. It is about $3 a pint.    ...
docs.abstract: Food Notes: Hagen-Dazs introduces margarita sorbet that tastes like frozen margarita; International Association of Women Chefs and Restaurateurs shortens name to Women Chefs and Restaurateurs and announces scholarship fund for 1996; Tavern on the Green restaurant will hold Passover seder for 300, one of largest being held by dozens of New York City's restaurants (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Haagen-Dazs Margaritas Haagen-Dazs has introduced a margarita sorbet that tastes just like a frozen margarita. The ingredients include tequila, but the label states that the product has less than 1 percent alcohol. It is about $3 a pint. Grants for Aspiring Restaurateurs The International Association of Women Chefs and Restaurateurs, a trade group founded in 1993, has shortened its name to Women Chefs and Restaurateurs and has announced a scholarship program for this year. Four women will receive a week's tutelage by Madeleine Kamman, a restaurateur and teacher, in her home in the Napa Valley of California. Another grant will cover a weeklong wine course at the Culinary Institute of America's campus in St. Helena, Calif., and a half scholarship will be available for the institute's 30-week baking and pastry course. The application deadline is July 1. Information: (415) 362-7336.

docs.snippet: A California Orange Year      Extended and heavy rain often means disaster for crops. But that apparently did not happen this year to California's navel oranges. The harvest is one of the largest recently, with a forecast of more than three billio...
docs.lead_paragraph: A California Orange Year Extended and heavy rain often means disaster for crops. But that apparently did not happen this year to California's navel oranges. The harvest is one of the largest recently, with a forecast of more than three billion oranges shipped to market by May. The oranges are bigger, with 44 percent graded as large, compared with 30 percent last year. They are also juicier and sweeter than usual, according to Sunkist Growers, the marketing cooperative in California. Prices are lower this year, too, on average 33 to 40 cents each, compared with an average of 50 cents a year ago.

docs.snippet: Fancy-Food Grocery     Novello, a 10,000-square-foot fancy-food store, opens today at 333 East 38th Street. It has arrived in Manhattan by way of Westchester County, a branch of John Chung's year-old Tarrytown Gourmet. Rob Wilson, the manager and ...
docs.abstract: Food Notes column; Novello fancy-food store opens on East 38th Street in Manhattan; apple harvest begins in upstate New York (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Fancy-Food Grocery Novello, a 10,000-square-foot fancy-food store, opens today at 333 East 38th Street. It has arrived in Manhattan by way of Westchester County, a branch of John Chung's year-old Tarrytown Gourmet. Rob Wilson, the manager and a partner, said the store features smoked salmon, olives, cheeses, charcuterie, produce and prepared food. The shiny wood-paneled brass-trimmed emporium also stocks a vast array of grocery items and condiments, including Novello's own line of spices. Soon, Tarrytown Gourmet will be renamed Novello.

docs.snippet: Low-Fat Haagen-Dazs      Haagen-Dazs has introduced a low-fat ice cream that comes in vanilla, chocolate, strawberry and coffee fudge. A half-cup serving of the vanilla, for example, has a fat content of 2.5 grams and contains 170 calories, 25 of ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Low-Fat Haagen-Dazs Haagen-Dazs has introduced a low-fat ice cream that comes in vanilla, chocolate, strawberry and coffee fudge. A half-cup serving of the vanilla, for example, has a fat content of 2.5 grams and contains 170 calories, 25 of them from fat. Regular Haagen-Dazs vanilla, with 18 grams of fat, has 270 calories, 160 of them from fat.

docs.snippet: A Scandinavian Holiday Boutique     The annual Scandinavian Christmas boutique of the American-Scandinavian Foundation, an educational group, will be held Friday through Sunday in the Alvar Aalto Penthouse of the Institute for International Educat...
docs.abstract: Food Notes column; Scandinavian Christmas boutique noted, along with changes in restaurant scene (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: A Scandinavian Holiday Boutique The annual Scandinavian Christmas boutique of the American-Scandinavian Foundation, an educational group, will be held Friday through Sunday in the Alvar Aalto Penthouse of the Institute for International Education, 809 United Nations Plaza (First Avenue and 46th Street). Food and other items will be sold. A smorgasbord, at $55 a person for lunch or dinner, will be served each day. Reservations: (212) 879-9588. Greek Food for a Cause

docs.snippet: Not Just for Indian Cooking     Julie Sahni's curry powder, one of a line of 10 herb and spice blends just introduced by Ms. Sahni, the author of many Indian cookbooks, has an exotic and complex flavor and fragrance hinting of cinnamon. The blends...
docs.lead_paragraph: Not Just for Indian Cooking Julie Sahni's curry powder, one of a line of 10 herb and spice blends just introduced by Ms. Sahni, the author of many Indian cookbooks, has an exotic and complex flavor and fragrance hinting of cinnamon. The blends are not just for Indian food. They include a Cajun mix and a chili powder, all salt-free.

docs.snippet: The Up and Down Price of Matzoh       The New York City Department of Consumer Affairs reports that this year, the average price for Passover foods has increased 4 percent over 1996 and that the price of a five-pound box of matzoh in supermarkets ...
docs.abstract: New York City Department of Consumer Affairs reports average price of Passover foods increased four percent in 1997 over 1996 (Food Notes) (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: The Up and Down Price of Matzoh The New York City Department of Consumer Affairs reports that this year, the average price for Passover foods has increased 4 percent over 1996 and that the price of a five-pound box of matzoh in supermarkets was $6.17, a decrease of 22 percent from last year. But it was a different story in Manhattan, where the average matzoh price in supermarkets was nearly double the average price in other boroughs, $8.35 compared with $4.85. Handmade shmura matzohs, the most strictly supervised kind, are available at Whole Foods, 117 Prince Street (Greene Street) and 2421 Broadway (89th Street). A one-pound box is $14.95, with $1 of each sale donated to the Simon Wiesenthal Center in Los Angeles. To order: (212) 874-4000. Neuman & Bogdonoff, 173 Chrystie Street (Delancey Street), is selling shmura matzoh for $20 a box and is donating $2 from each sale to Temple Shaaray Tefila on the Upper West Side. To order: (212) 228-2444.
